sub_topic: Predicting the products of inorganic reactions
message_1: What will be the products of the reaction between magnesium metal and hydrochloric acid? Write the balanced chemical equation for the reaction and identify the type of reaction.
message_2:
When magnesium metal reacts with hydrochloric acid, the products formed are magnesium chloride and hydrogen gas. The balanced chemical equation for the reaction is:

Mg (s) + 2 HCl (aq) → MgCl₂ (aq) + H₂ (g)

This reaction is an example of a single displacement reaction, where magnesium displaces hydrogen from hydrochloric acid to form magnesium chloride and hydrogen gas.
